text: Mauk: BARREL and Van Allen data will help study microbursts of electrons into atmosphere
Mauk: Van Allen Probes works with BARREL (@keV_balloons) balloon launches from Antarctica, studies electron emissions with Van Allen
Mauk: Probes are contributing to understanding how magnetic storms develop, and their consequences
Mauk: Ultra-low frequency (ULF) waves interact with energized electrons in important ways in the belts; looking at other ULF characteristics
Mauk: Best guess is that internal energization is caused by whistler wave interactions (chorus)
Mauk: Discussing Phase Space Density, which is similar to the intensity of photons in an optical system
Mauk: We observed fast energetic energization of electrons during magnetic storms: How does this occur? Is it external or internal?
Mauk: We're learning how whistler waves and hiss affect the belts differently
Mauk: Third belt is moderated by plasmasphere of cold ionized gases, which acts as a buffer
Mauk: The robust and persistent emergence of three belts was a shock; coherent processes cause this emergence
Mauk: Probes have shown belts to be highly dynamic, we knew they were, but now we have very high resolution views
Mauk: What have we learned scientifically so far? Traditional view of two belts has changed; we have seen three belt regions
Now speaking: APL's Barry Mauk, Van Allen Probes project scientist
Fox: Showing data from new real-time space weather visualization product, data from beginning of mission to now
Fox: Two stations (KASI and Czech Republic) dedicated to collecting this space weather data - can see data on http://t.co/cYvB3jgBYc
Fox: Each probe broadcasts space weather data about 21.5 hours per day
Fox: Space weather broadcast successes in 1st year: Data sent at all times science data is not coming down
Fox: Spacecraft lap each other 4 to 5 times per year; sunward-spin axis; two-year primary mission; space weather broadcast
Fox: We knew some things about the belts but not why they occur. Mission provides multi-point sampling to understand particle behaviors
Fox: How does ring current affect the belts? These and other questions are what Van Allen was launched to help answer.
Fox: Only way to understand is physics: How do particles change in belts? Why do some particles leave the bel
Fox: Van Allen radiation belts were first discovery of the Space Age, and 50 years later, still full of mysterious behaviors
Now speaking: APL's Nicky Fox, Van Allen Probes deputy project scientist - talking about goals at launch and new space weather tools
Van Allen's great launch courtesy hard work from @JHUAPL @NASAKennedy @ulalaunch teams
Cooper: For June review, spacecraft are healthy, science ops are nominal, and mission is operating successfully
Cooper: In Dec, started working with @keV_balloons (BARREL) team, launching balloons from Antarctica
Cooper: Very successful commissioning, followed by renaming to Van Allen Probes to honor the late James Van Allen
Cooper: Soon after launch, started commissioning (bringing systems and instruments on line) - 60 days, completed Oct 29 2012
Now speaking is APL's Kim Cooper, Van Allen Probes project manager--showing video of Van Allen (then RBSP) launch at 4:05 am Aug 30 2012
Coming to you live from @JHUAPL - site of the Van Allen Probes First Year lunchtime lecture - we're livetweeting
.@NASA's Van Allen Probes launched Aug. 30, 2012--it's been a year of discovery & excitement, with more to come http://t.co/s1MTGhS05O
From @NASA: "Something big is happening on the sun. The sun's global magnetic field is about to flip." #SolarMax http://t.co/S1rptHKexm
RT @sciencemagazine: Twin @VanAllenProbes trace how electrons in the belt get their boost of killer energy http://t.co/JSxbHE6hF5 #astronomy

retweeted_status.text: Twin @VanAllenProbes trace how electrons in the belt get their boost of killer energy http://t.co/JSxbHE6hF5 #astronomy

text: More from @NASA on the new discovery of the particle accelerator within the Van Allen radiation belts: http://t.co/h4CRKm7nUx
Newly-discovered massive particle accelerator in the heart of one of the harshest regions of near-Earth space http://t.co/Rchx6cq43M

The importance of understanding space weather, featuring Van Allen Probes' (and @LASPatCU's) Daniel Baker
http://t.co/HdBMfF6T7Y
At @JHUAPL, Christina worked on RBSPICE (Ion Composition Experiment) for Van Allen, & other particle detectors incl. JEDI on @NASAJuno
Congrats to Van Allen Probes team member Christina Hammock from @JHUAPL, selected for @NASA astronaut training! http://t.co/4Z9Q6PpZRY
New research from the @UCLA Dept. of Atmospheric & Oceanic Sciences explains development of 3rd radiation belt http://t.co/pRV76uy6Ga
The updated Van Allen Probes fact sheet is now available: http://t.co/fFCYP1XnYf http://t.co/gfsDbKc4GG
The collected live tweets by Van Allen Probes from the 2013 Space Weather Enterprise Forum: http://t.co/bejP3r44FT #SWEF
Leith: USGS research and assets provide geomagnetic activity data that is part of drawing the picture #SWEF
Was was the Carrington event?  Learn about this huge solar storm here: http://t.co/0rCPk6qMER
Dr. William Leith, Senior Science Advisor for Earthquake and Geologic Hazards @USGS #SWEF
Behnke: Space weather is use-inspired basic research (Pasteur's quadrant on the famous chart). NSF is foundation of national program #SWEF
Behnke: We're tackling key science questions: Understanding processes, better observations, improved sun to Earth models #SWEF
Dr. Richard Behnke, head of Geospace Section, @NSF: NSF has been pioneer and lead contributor in understanding space weather #SWEF
Uccellini: NOAA has improved models (better forecasting); space weather forecasting still where terrestrial weather was in the 70s #SWEF
.@NOAA Assistant Administrator Dr. Louis Uccellini, Director, @usNWSgov: Working on enhancing space weather capabilities #SWEF
Elsbernd: Launched Van Allen Probes in Aug 12; almost immediately discovered third belt. #SWEF
Elsbernd: 18 operating heliophysics missions. Five missions have space weather utility. #SWEF
.@NASA's Victoria Elsbernd, Acting Director, Heliophysics: Objective is to understand sun and interactions with Earth & solar system #SWEF
Egentowich: USAF Space Weather turns out 40K+ products daily #SWEF
Egentowich: USAF does space weather analysis and forecasting, leverages and shares info with DoD and civilian agencies #SWEF
.@USAIRFORCE's Col. John Egentowich, discussing Air Force Partnerships. Space weather is a "total team sport." #SWEF
.@NOAA's Mary Kicza: Discussing new space weather assets coming on line in the coming years #SWEF
Session 4: The Unified National Space Weather Capability - led by Dr. Louis Lanzerotti, @NJIT (PI for RBSPICE on Van Allen Probes) #SWEF
.@LASPatCU's Dr. Daniel Baker is lead on the REPT instrument, part of the ECT suite on Van Allen Probes #SWEF
Baker: Although the public, industry and policy makers are becoming more aware of space weather, we can work to help improve this. #SWEF
Baker: We need a coordinated national approach to raise awareness and understanding of space weather. #SWEF
Now up: Dr. Daniel Baker of @LASPatCU on "Space Weather Public Awareness and Response: Possible Ways Forward" #SWEF
Kelly: Traditional space weather parameters would not have picked up this local effect. Came up with way to simulate.  #SWEF
Kelly: Satcom lines of sight passed through regions of depleted ionospheric electron density (from @NASA's GUVI) #SWEF
Kelly: Comms warning, not received, to not land a rescue helicopter; failure linked in part to space weather. Four KIA.  #SWEF
Kelly: In Afghanistan, ionosphere suffers from local disturbances and solar storms; these affects comms #SWEF
Kelly: Analysis of 2002's Operation Anaconda at Takur Ghar in Afghanistan, satcom effects #SWEF
Now up: Dr. Michael Kelly from @JHUAPL "Space Weather Impacts on UHF SATCOM in Operation Anaconda: Prospects for Forecasting" #SWEF
Koza: Scientific community is making steady progress, and now the industry "gets it" and is preparing. But what size event? #SWEF
Koza: We can accurately model and analyze power systems; now, we can add space weather research to understand impacts & mitigation #SWEF
Koza: What would happen if another, extreme Carrington-level solar event? We really don't know. #SWEF
Koza: Will reduce west to east flow during large solar storm, reduces flow across system, boost voltage. #SWEF
Koza: In 1989 Quebec solar storm, when more than 10 amp change in line, that's when problems started. #SWEF
Koza: This can cause generator problems, voltage collapses. We rely on humans to intervene. #SWEF
Koza: Space weather affects the power grid: Currents induced in ground and come up through transformers or transmission lines #SWEF
Now up: Frank Koza from PJM Interconnection, an electricity transmission company. #SWEF
Fahey: Improved space weather forecasting needed for both safety and efficiency. #SWEF
Scott: When doing a polar reroute, fuel costs rise because of new routing. Also need to communicate with Russia to change route. #SWEF
Scott: Talking about what space weather does to airline operations. #SWEF
Fahey: Polar overflight routes have communications and health related issues during strong geomagnetic & solar storms. #SWEF
Now up: Thomas Fahey and Gregg Scott, @Delta Airlines: "Delta Hazard Avoidance Procedures & Use of Space Weather Information" #SWEF
Zapp: Reviewing solar particle activity during 2006 STS-116--shot up unexpectedly around EVA 2 egress. #SWEF
Zapp: Space Radiation Analysis Group in operation since Mercury program. #SWEF
Zapp: Idea is to evolve from source to effect modeling in solar system. #SWEF
Zapp: Analysts are critical to providing information and talking with spacecraft operators. #SWEF
Zapp: Used to think space weather unpredictable; now, that has changed and it is possible #SWEF
Zapp: Definition of space weather is changing and growing more complex, to reflect what we've learned about its wide-ranging effects #SWEF
Now up: @NASA Dr. Neal Zapp from the Space Radiation Group: "NASA and Space Weather: Nominal Impacts and Mitigations" #SWEF
Kicza: We're going to look at frequent but somewhat unnoticed effects of space weather #SWEF
Session 3: "Understanding the Day-to-Day Impacts of Space Weather," mod. is Mary E. Kicza, @NOAA Assistant Administrator #SWEF
Kozyra: Space weather is a world-wide problem. There are international programs that coordinate efforts and foster research. #SWEF
Kozyra: We're making new findings, including new 3rd radiation belt observed by Van Allen Probes, and SDO observing core flux rope. #SWEF
Kozyra: Many key unknowns about solar storms and interactions with Earth. #SWEF
Kozyra: Breakthroughs require new ways of thinking. Prediction is difficult. Still a lot of unknowns in systems. #SWEF
Kozyra: Understanding sun-Earth system is one of greatest challenges of our generation. Greater than sum of parts. #SWEF
Now up: @UMich's Dr. Janet Kozyra "Space Weather Research: The Flip Side of Effective Forecasting" #SWEF
Newman: We have empirical model, would like to move to physics-based model in future. Looking to improve models and risk assessment #SWEF
Newman: We can't determine effect of CMEs on atmospheric density, but we can determine less or more risky. #SWEF
Newman: Robotic Conjunction Assessment Risk Assessment Process; spacecraft orbit close approaches. Space weather changes orbits. #SWEF
Newman: Saw lost satellites grow during increased solar activity in 2012. Also increased orbit decay rate #SWEF
Newman: Atmospheric drag is increased by space weather, and affects satellite position. "Lost" spacecraft=not seen in 30 days. #SWEF
Now up: @NASA's Lauri Newman on "The Effects of Space Weather of Space Situational Awareness" #SWEF
Campbell: A football field-sized sail in space would feel same force as a having a quarter and penny dropped on it #SWEF
Campbell; Solar sails are pushed by sunlight, not solar wind. Sunlight creates a force on a body in space. #SWEF
Now up: Dr. Bruce Campbell from @ATK Space Systems: "Solar Sail Space Weather Capabilities" #SWEF
Wargo: The @NASA fleet today and in future will contribute to understanding of space weather #SWEF
Wargo: Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter motto: Science enables exploration, exploration enables science. This is key. #SWEF
Wargo's talk is "Enabling Safe, Effective, and Efficient Exploration of the Solar System" #SWEF
Wargo: We now have identified things called "Strategic Knowledge Gaps," which can help us move research forward. #SWEF
Now speaking: @NASA's Dr. Michael Wargo, Chief Exploration Scientist, Human Exploration and Operations Mission Directorate #SWEF
Guhathakurta: If low solar activity, still need to study sun. "The sun is never boring." #SWEF
Guhathakurta: Mercury gets most ferocious space weather; @MESSENGER2011 has studied effects #SWEF
Guhathakurta: 3 pressing areas for space weather research: human safety, spacecraft operations and scientific research #SWEF
Guhathakurta: NASA and other agencies must know when solar storm will pass through space. In Mar 12, 50 flares, 15 spacecraft affected #SWEF
Guhathakurta: On Feb 6 2011, STEREO reached 180-deg out of phase - first view of entire sun - birth of interplanetary space weather #SWEF
Guhathakurta: Space weather is very much a research frontier. It is a complex system and process that we are embedded in. #SWEF
Now: @NASA's Dr. Madhulika (Lika) Guhathakurta, Program Scientist for Van Allen Probes #SWEF
McCoy: Understanding and research increased greatly recently. Topics include forecasting, robotics, @NASA heliophysics plans #SWEF
"Scientific Understanding, Observations, and Future Understanding" session - Dr. Robert McCoy, moderator
Williamson: @NJIT's Dr. Louis Lanzerotti (a Van Allen Probes PI) was big part of helping NSWP 2006 study that led org. forward #SWEF
Williamson: National Space Weather Program est. in 1995 to create strategic plan for space weather #SWEF
Williamson: Recent rise in solar activity and impacts that can occur at any time; want to raise public awareness and readiness #SWEF
Sullivan: We are all working to protect the citizens of little blue planet from this star that we live with. #SWEF
Sullivan: New work by @ESA on space weather research and prioritization, part of global efforts. Need to build awareness, resilience #SWEF
Sullivan: Space weather affects power systems, air travel and transport, space-based technologies. Global concern, efforts growing #SWEF
Sullivan: Study says that 20-40M in US at risk of prolonged power outage if another Carrington-level event #SWEF
Sullivan: Need strong partnerships to move information across science, industry, government, and public. #SWEF
Sullivan: Goal is a space weather-ready nation. Good information gets to decision makers fast. #SWEF
Sullivan: Need for intelligence on space weather-->33K subscribers to @NOAA space weather alerts and warnings. GPS user growth is up #SWEF
Sullivan: Better information=better planning and infrastructure investments. Space weather is 1 of 6 National Exercise Programs #SWEF
Sullivan: Growth in high technology infrastructure comes with price: susceptibility to space weather. Goal is to minimize impacts. #SWEF
Sullivan: Goal is seamless enterprise for space weather forecasting to protect vulnerable infrastructure #SWEF
Sullivan: If threat exists now, do something now--this was call to action in 2012 from Pres. Obama about space weather research #SWEF
Sullivan: Proud of work @NOAA forecasters did recently in Midwest to help protect their communities; they're on watch right now. #SWEF
Now speaking: @NOAA acting administrator Dr. Kathryn Sullivan, 1st U.S. woman to walk in space. 3 STS missions. #SWEF
Bolden: Space weather is now recognized by United Nations as significant issue to study #SWEF
Bolden: @NASA is working with @NOAA on a new mission. Many other missions in progress that will study specific elements #SWEF
.@NASA's Bolden: 18 missions (including Van Allen Probes) studying sun-Earth connection & space weather events throughout solar system #SWEF
.@NASA's Bolden: Important for nation to advance understanding of space weather. Crucial to exploration objectives, human & robotic #SWEF
.@NASA's Bolden: Expressing thanks of nation to @NOAA, others for warnings and aid during tornado outbreaks in Midwest #SWEF
Now speaking: @NASA Administrator Charles Bolden - Discussing his 2 shuttle missions w/ @NOAA's Dr. Kathryn Sullivan #SWEF
Palazzo: Solar radiation is big challenge for human space exploration; we're protected on Earth by radiation belts #SWEF
Palazzo: Focus on future space weather research & #STEM education, next gen of scientists. Team effort: agencies, academia, industry #SWEF
Palazzo - Never underestimate importance of understanding space environment. Important elements of exploration. #SWEF
Now speaking is U.S. Rep. Steven M. Palazzo - Discussing importance of understanding the sun-Earth system & space weather. Can affect #GPS
The #SWEF theme is "Space Weather Impacts: They Happen All The Time"
Welcome to #SWEF -- now speaking is Samuel Williamson of the National Space Weather Program Council
Getting ready for today's Space Weather Enterprise Forum at @NOAA - we'll be live-tweeeting some of the discussions #SWEF
.@NASA's Image of the Day is of the #BARREL team launching in Antarctica in Jan. 2013 - http://t.co/gJ2MyVLCXm http://t.co/kJbzaUEbMF
MT @SethInSpace: @nprnews story about @NASA's Van Allen Probes and killer radiation belt electrons. Cool! http://t.co/8XoBLrPkRY …
Learn how @dartmouth physicists Mary Hudson and Robyn Millan are studying the Van Allen belts http://t.co/L9rhBzpzU1
